chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L Vargas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Cours Office

Reminder Notice

Count 1:  Non-Probation
Count 2:  Dismissed and Read In

9:25 AM Defendant Robert L Vargas in court.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Robert L Vargas.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 will be dismissed and read in. 
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1.
Clerk directed to enter judgment of conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Pay costs.
60 days to pay or set up payment plan.

matter set for plea/sent 10/4/22 at 8:30

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:15 PM Defendant Robert L Vargas in court.  Attorney Kelly Cassiday appears on behalf of Atty Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Robert L Vargas. 

No written waiver was completed.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
